Question: Navigation Instruction given at initial position: [take off fly straight to the opposite building before reaching the building turn left and turn right and fly downwards to the road fly near the crossway and turn right and fly upwards to the second tall building fly to the top of the building. after reaching the top of the building turn left and fly straight to the river and fly at the right side of the building and cross the first checkpoint and fly in to the road presented in the bridge. after entering in to the bridge fly straight to the road which ends in the opposite of the bridge.]. At the initial position, you are asked to move according to a series of movement instructions. What are you doing now?  
choose:  
A. I fly directly to the opposite building.  
B. I fly to the top of the building.  
C. I fly to the right of the building and go through the first checkpoint.  
D. I fly onto the road over the bridge.  
E. I fly upwards over tall buildings.

textgrad_result.init_answer: Option: D; Reason: The sequence of images shows the agent moving towards and then over a bridge, aligning with the instruction to "fly in to the road presented in the bridge." The final frames depict a view from the bridge looking towards the city, indicating that the agent has successfully navigated onto the road over the bridge.
